skill.name: n8n
skill.description: n8n workflow automation patterns and API integration. This skill should be used when creating n8n workflows, using webhooks, managing workflows via REST API, or integrating n8n with MCP servers. Covers workflow JSON structure, node patterns, and automation best practices.

skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference files. No executable code, scripts, network operations, filesystem access beyond its own files, or environment variable access. The skill provides n8n workflow patterns as educational reference material.

content.value_statement: Building n8n workflows requires understanding JSON structure, node patterns, and REST API endpoints. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for webhooks, API integrations, and automation workflows that work with your n8n instance.
actual_capabilities: Generate n8n workflow JSON structures with nodes and connections
Create webhook-triggered workflows with HTTP endpoints
Implement HTTP Request nodes for external API calls
Build conditional branching logic with IF and Switch nodes
Manage n8n workflows via REST API endpoints
Integrate n8n with MCP servers for Claude Code
limitations: Does not connect to running n8n instances or execute workflows
Does not store or manage n8n API keys or credentials
Does not modify n8n configuration or settings
Requires existing n8n instance with API access

output_examples.input: Create a webhook workflow that receives form submissions and sends them to Slack
output: Set node to extract form fields from the incoming JSON
HTTP Request node posts formatted message to Slack webhook URL
Respond to Webhook node returns success confirmation

best_practices: Use the Error Trigger node to capture and notify on workflow failures
Test webhooks using the /webhook-test/ path before deploying to production
Store API credentials in n8n credentials system, never hardcode them in workflow JSON
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys directly in workflow JSON parameters
Skipping error handling for external API calls
Using the production webhook path during workflow development

faq.question: What n8n version is required for this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with n8n 0.180+ which includes the REST API and MCP server features.

faq.question: Can this skill execute workflows on my n8n instance?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides workflow patterns and documentation. You must deploy workflows to your n8n instance directly.

faq.question: How do I connect to my n8n instance?
faq.answer: Configure N8N_HOST, N8N_PORT, and N8N_API_KEY environment variables for your local or remote instance.

faq.question: Is my workflow data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill is read-only documentation. Workflows run entirely within your n8n instance.

faq.question: Why is my webhook returning 404 errors?
faq.answer: Ensure the webhook path matches exactly and the workflow is active. Use /webhook-test/ path for testing.

faq.question: How does this compare to other automation tools?
faq.answer: n8n is open-source and self-hostable with full API access. Unlike cloud-only tools, you maintain full control of your data and infrastructure.
